author: Rafael Oliva
title: Palmeiras sonha com Matheus Pereira, do Cruzeiro, e avalia oferta milion√°ria - R√°dio Itatiaia
text:
O [Palmeiras ](https://www.itatiaia.com.br/esportes/futebol/palmeiras)tem um novo nome no radar para a atual janela de transfer√™ncias: Matheus Pereira, meia do [Cruzeiro](https://www.itatiaia.com.br/esportes/futebol/cruzeiro). O clube tem interesse em contrat√°-lo e estuda apresentar uma oferta que gira em torno de 12,5 milh√µes de euros (aproximadamente R$ 80 milh√µes).
At√© o momento, a proposta n√£o foi oficialmente apresentada. A Raposa promete fazer jogo duro caso o Verd√£o avance no interesse e busque a contrata√ß√£o do jogador.
O clube celeste pretende abrir conversas por Matheus Pereira inicialmente por 25 milh√µes de euros (cerca de R$ 160 milh√µes), valor muito acima do que o Alviverde planeja propor.
A informa√ß√£o sobre a poss√≠vel oferta do Palmeiras por Matheus Pereira foi publicada pelo ‚ÄúGe‚Äù e confirmada pela Itatiaia. O Cruzeiro afirma que n√£o recebeu contatos oficiais at√© agora.
Pedrinho se posiciona sobre situa√ß√£o de Matheus Pereira
S√≥cio majorit√°rio do Cruzeiro, [Pedro Louren√ßo concedeu entrevista √† Itatiaia nesta semana e abriu o jogo sobre a situa√ß√£o de Matheus Pereira](https://www.itatiaia.com.br/esportes/futebol/cruzeiro/2024/12/23/cruzeiro-recebeu-proposta-por-matheus-pereira-pedro-lourenco-abre-o-jogo). Segundo ele, o clube n√£o recebeu ofertas pelo jogador.
‚ÄúN√≥s n√£o recebemos nenhuma proposta oficial de nenhum clube. Se especula daqui ou dali, mas n√£o recebemos nenhuma proposta. Dizem que o Palmeiras quer o Matheus (Pereira), mas n√≥s mesmo n√£o recebemos nenhuma proposta. E n√≥s n√£o temos interesse de tirar o Matheus, o Marlon, todos s√£o importantes‚Äù, disse Pedrinho.
Pedro Louren√ßo tamb√©m refor√ßou que n√£o existe interesse de se desfazer do camisa 10. Uma negocia√ß√£o s√≥ deve avan√ßar se a proposta apresentada for considerada alta.
‚ÄúEstamos trazendo mais jogadores, n√£o podemos tirar o nosso camisa 10. Se vir proposta e for interessante para o jogador, para o Cruzeiro, for algo fora da curva... Mas se depender de n√≥s, Cruzeiro, n√£o vamos vender nenhum jogador que tem‚Äù, completou.
Um dos principais atletas da Raposa em 2024, Matheus Pereira marcou 11 gols e distribuiu 15 assist√™ncias em 59 jogos na temporada. No Verd√£o, ele disputaria posi√ß√£o com Raphael Veiga e Mauricio.

author: R√©daction BP
title: Chevigny-Saint-Sauveur. Suppression de 85 postes chez JTEKT : les √©lus r√©agissent
text:
Chevigny-Saint-Sauveur Suppression de 85 postes chez JTEKT : les √©lus r√©agissent
Le 26 mars, l'entreprise JTEKT a pr√©sent√© son plan de sauvegarde de l'emploi √† Chevigny-Saint-Sauveur. Le maire de la commune, Guillaume Ruet, la premi√®re √©dile de Dijon, Natalie Koenders, et le pr√©sident de Dijon M√©tropole, Fran√ßois Rebsamen, ont pris la parole concernant la suppression de 85 postes sur le site industriel.
L'entreprise JTEKT a pr√©sent√© mercredi matin son plan de sauvegarde de l'emploi pour le site de Chevigny-Saint-Sauveur aux repr√©sentants du personnel. L'√©quipementier automobile a fait part d'une r√©organisation de son activit√© en France avec la suppression de 197 emplois dont 85 sur le site situ√© en agglom√©ration de Dijon.
Dans un contexte de crise mondiale du secteur automobile, plusieurs √©lus ont tenu √† manifester leur soutien aux salari√©s et aux familles √† l'image de Guillaume Ruet, maire de Chevigny-Saint-Sauveur et conseiller d√©partemental, Nathalie Koenders, premi√®re √©dile de Dijon et Fran√ßois Rebsamen, pr√©sident de Dijon m√©tropole.
¬´ Je suis particuli√®rement pr√©occup√© par cette annonce ¬ª
Le maire de Chevigny-Saint-Sauveur a exprim√© son inqui√©tude face √† cette restructuration qui n'est pas un cas isol√© dans le d√©partement et l'agglom√©ration. ¬´ Je suis particuli√®rement pr√©occup√© par cette annonce. La Ville de Chevigny, en concert avec Dijon M√©tropole, sera tr√®s vigilante au respect de la promesse de l‚Äôentreprise de minimiser l‚Äôimpact social de cette restructuration ¬ª, d√©clare Guillaume Ruet.
Face √† la suppression d'emplois dans d'autres entreprises comme Tetra Pak √† Longvic ou encore PPG - la Seigneurie √† Genlis, le marie estime que la situation est ¬´ tr√®s pr√©occupante et n√©cessite une r√©action rapide et forte au plus haut sommet de l‚ÄôEtat, afin de soutenir nos entreprises et usines fran√ßaises qui sont fragilis√©es par l‚Äôinstabilit√© √©conomique que nous traversons ¬ª.
JTEKT, un pilier du patrimoine √©conomique local
La maire de Dijon, Nathalie Koenders, se veut rassurante pour les salari√©s : ¬´ Nous restons disponibles pour toute discussion et collaboration afin de trouver des solutions viables et p√©rennes pour les salari√©s de JTEKT et pour l‚Äôensemble de notre territoire. ¬ª
Dans un communiqu√© commun, la maire de Dijon et Fran√ßois Rebsamen, pr√©sident de la m√©tropole, indiquent que la m√©tropole ¬´ a √©tabli depuis plusieurs mois des contacts resserr√©s avec l‚Äôentreprise √† travers son agence de d√©veloppement √©conomique, Dijon Bourgogne Invest, et en coop√©ration avec l‚ÄôUIMM, afin d‚Äôexplorer toutes les pistes possibles de diversification d‚Äôactivit√© ¬ª.

author: Press Trust Of India
title: New Zealand vs Bangladesh 2nd T20I called-off due to incessant rain
text: Mount Maunganui: Rain washed out the second Twenty20 international between New Zealand and Bangladesh after only 11 overs Friday, leaving Bangladesh with a 1-0 lead in the three-match series. The match began on time and New Zealand was 72-2 after 11 overs when the heavy rain which had fallen throughout the day in this seaside city returned to Bay Oval. Bangladesh Tour of New Zealand Bangladesh üÜö New Zealand | 2nd T20I NO RESULT üåßÔ∏è [#BCB]| [#Cricket]| [#NZvBAN] [pic.twitter.com/fG3xYASaps] ‚Äî Bangladesh Cricket (@BCBtigers) [December 29, 2023] The third match of the series will be played at the same venue on Sunday. Bangladesh won the toss Friday and sent New Zealand in as it did in the first match of the series, which it won by five wickets for its first ever T20 win over New Zealand in New Zealand. Finn Allen again fell early, dismissed in the second over, but Tim Seifert struck six fours and a six in a quickfire innings of 43 from 23 balls. Bangladesh had begun to curtail the New Zealand run rate when the rain returned. Players left the field at 8 p.m. and umpires called off the match just before 10 p.m. when not even a five over shootout was possible. Read [Latest News](https://www.news9live.com/latest-news) and [Breaking News](https://www.news9live.com/) at News9 Live, Browse for more [Cricket News](https://www.news9live.com/sports/cricket-news)

author: Al Jazeera Staff
title: Five key takeaways from Joe Biden‚Äôs 2024 State of the Union address | Joe Biden News | Al Jazeera
text: US president touts economic record, slams Donald Trump and calls on Israel to allow more aid into Gaza in heated speech. Washington, DC ‚Äì US President Joe Biden has touted his administration‚Äôs economic record and sought to distinguish himself from his predecessor Donald Trump, as he delivered his [third State of the Union address](/news/2024/3/6/biden-to-deliver-state-of-the-union-address-all-you-need-to-know) just months before a United States presidential election. Addressing a joint session of Congress on Thursday evening, the Democratic president repeatedly hit out at Trump, but did not mention his Republican rival by name. Keep readinglist of 3 items [Will Joe Biden and Donald Trump face each other in the US elections?](/program/inside-story/2024/3/6/will-joe-biden-and-donald-trump-face-each-other-in-the-us-elections?traffic_source=KeepReading) [‚ÄòSubdued revenge‚Äô: Why Biden‚Äôs top officials hosted Israel‚Äôs Gantz](/news/2024/3/6/subdued-revenge-why-bidens-top-officials-hosted-israels-gantz?traffic_source=KeepReading) ‚ÄúMy purpose tonight is to wake up the Congress and alert the American people that this is no ordinary moment,‚Äù Biden said, warning that ‚Äúfreedom and democracy are under attack both at home and overseas‚Äù. Recent polls show Biden and Trump neck-and-neck in their [push for the White House](/news/2024/3/6/five-takeaways-from-the-us-super-tuesday-primary-races), and their looming rematch in November‚Äôs presidential election cast a large shadow over Thursday‚Äôs State of the Union. The speech provided an important platform for Biden, who continues to face questions over whether he is fit enough to seek a second term, as well as protests over his staunch backing of Israel despite its [deadly military offensive](/news/liveblog/2024/3/7/israels-war-on-gaza-live-20-starve-to-death-in-gaza-more-feared-dead) in the Gaza Strip. Here are five key takeaways from his 2024 State of the Union address. US to build ‚Äòtemporary pier‚Äô to boost Gaza aid Biden, who has faced months of fierce criticism for his [unwavering support for Israel](/news/longform/2024/1/30/defies-logic-the-makings-of-joe-bidens-blank-cheque-to-israel) amid the Gaza war, announced that his administration would build a ‚Äútemporary pier‚Äù off the coast of the Palestinian territory to facilitate aid deliveries. The pier will be able to ‚Äúreceive large shipments carrying food, water, medicine and temporary shelter‚Äù, Biden said during his speech, without specifying how long it would take to set up. The move comes a week after the US [air-dropped 36,000 meals](/news/2024/3/2/us-airdrops-food-to-gaza-in-move-criticised-by-aid-organisations) to hundreds of thousands of starving people in northern Gaza. But the Biden administration has ruled out conditioning aid or stopping weapon transfers to Israel to pressure it to allow more assistance into Gaza, stressing that its support for the US ally remains ‚Äúironclad‚Äù. Critics of Biden‚Äôs stance said the Gaza pier will likely fail to alleviate a growing hunger crisis in the territory. Israel has blocked aid deliveries as it continues its military offensive. ‚ÄúIt seems to be just another effort to divert attention from the real issue here, which is that 700,000 people are starving from north Gaza down, and Israel is not allowing humanitarian aid needed to them,‚Äù Palestinian politician Mustafa Barghouti told Al Jazeera ahead of Biden‚Äôs address. More than 100 protesters demanding a Gaza ceasefire blocked a road leading to the US Capitol ahead of the speech on Thursday night. ‚ÄúWhat do we want? Permanent ceasefire. When do we want it? Now,‚Äù they chanted. Pledges Ukraine support, touts pro-Israel bona fides While Biden urged Israel to allow more aid into the Gaza Strip, he [stressed](/news/longform/2024/1/30/defies-logic-the-makings-of-joe-bidens-blank-cheque-to-israel) that has been a ‚Äúlifelong supporter‚Äù of the US ally. ‚ÄúNo one has a stronger requisition than I do. I challenge any of you here,‚Äù he said. He also urged Congress to [unblock aid to Ukraine](/news/2024/2/11/ukraine-aid-package-approval-gains-momentum-after-key-us-senate-vote) to help the country fend off Russia‚Äôs invasion. A growing number of Republican legislators have raised opposition to the high price tag of continued US funding for Kyiv. ‚ÄúMy message to President Putin, who I‚Äôve known for a long time, is simple: We will not walk away. We will not bow down. I will not bow down,‚Äù Biden said. He also hit out at [Trump](/news/2024/2/11/white-house-blasts-trumps-unhinged-nato-comments) for saying that he would tell Russia ‚Äúto do whatever the hell they want‚Äù to a NATO country that does not spend enough on defence. ‚ÄúA former president actually said that, bowing down to a Russian leader,‚Äù Biden said during his address. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs outrageous. It‚Äôs dangerous and it‚Äôs unacceptable.‚Äù Contrast with Republican rival Trump Biden has long tried to present himself as a bulwark protecting American democracy against Trump and the former Republican president‚Äôs Make America Great Again (MAGA) base ‚Äî and that was a major theme again on Thursday night. A mob of the Trump‚Äôs supporters stormed the US Capitol in January 2021, in an attempt to stop Congress from certifying Biden‚Äôs 2020 election victory. Trump also faces [two criminal cases](/news/2023/8/2/trump-indictment-tracker-where-do-cases-against-former-us-president-stand) linked to his efforts to overturn the election results. During his State of the Union address, Biden took multiple jabs at his Republican rival. ‚ÄúMy predecessor and some of you here seek to bury the truth about January 6 ‚Äì I will not do that,‚Äù Biden said. ‚ÄúHere is the simple truth: You can‚Äôt love your country only when you win.‚Äù Al Jazeera‚Äôs Kimberly Halkett, reporting from the US Capitol, said Biden mentioned Trump at least 10 times throughout his speech, referring to him as ‚Äúmy predecessor‚Äù. ‚ÄúIt really was more of a campaign speech than it was a State of the Union speech,‚Äù Halkett said. ‚ÄúIt was unusual for the fact that not only did [Biden] mention him once, but he continued to mention him throughout the speech with each topic that was mentioned.‚Äù Abortion, reproductive rights Biden also has tried to distinguish himself and his Democratic Party from American conservatives who celebrated a 2022 Supreme Court [decision](/news/2022/6/24/roe-v-wade-us-supreme-court-overturns-landmark-abortion-ruling) overturning of Roe v Wade. That landmark ruling had enshrined the constitutional right to abortion in the US for decades. Republican-led states passed a slew of [abortion restrictions and bans](/news/2023/6/23/how-abortion-became-an-achilles-heel-for-us-republicans) after Roe was overturned, spurring outrage. The issue resonates with many Democratic voters who have continued to call for access to abortion and reproductive health care. On Thursday night, Biden promised to defend access to abortion nationwide. ‚ÄúIf you, the American people, send me a Congress that supports the right to choose, I will restore Roe v Wade as the law of the land again,‚Äù he said. Citing recent election victories for Democrats since the right to abortion was revoked, the US president also said the ‚Äúelectoral power‚Äù of women will help his party win votes again in November. He also blamed Trump for the fall of Roe; the Republican president appointed three conservative justices to the Supreme Court who helped overturn the legal precedent. Economy, economy, economy Much of Biden‚Äôs speech focused on domestic issues, the most important of which was his administration‚Äôs handling of the economy. The US president said he inherited an economy ‚Äúon the brink‚Äù during the COVID-19 pandemic, but his policies helped revive it. ‚ÄúNow our economy is literally the envy of the world ‚Äì 15 million new jobs in just three years,‚Äù he said. Biden also paid a nod to US labour unions and the American middle class, while stressing that he plans to ensure that corporations pay their fair share. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a capitalist. You want to make a million or millions of bucks? That‚Äôs great. Just pay your fair share in taxes,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúA fair tax code is how we invest to make this country great.‚Äù
